name: General Magic
overview: On December 29, 2009, General Magic, Inc. went out of business as per its Chapter 11 liquidation filing under bankruptcy. This record represents the public shell of General Magic, Inc. General Magic, Inc. offers a suite of voice infrastructure software products that enable the creation of personality-rich voice access to new and existing Web-based enterprise applications. This product suite, known as magicTalkÂ®, comprises Voice Gateway and the Enterprise Platform. The Voice Gateway integrates speech recognition, text-to-speech, media resources, and telephony technologies with a VoiceXML interpreter to enable user-friendly telephone access to new or existing enterprise applications and information. The Enterprise Platform, enterprise-class voice infrastructure software, allows Web and Javaâ„¢ developers to create their own brand of voice applications that communicate to the end user through the magicTalk Voice Gateway. In addition, General Magic product training, voice user interface design consulting, technical support, and hosting. On May 13 2002, the company received approval from The Nasdaq Stock Market to transfer its listing from the National Market to the SmallCap Market effective at the opening of business today.
